item.title: Stupid me... Pickup again... 1 error now!
item.dc:creator: @gon3d34d123 gon3d34d123
item.description:
@gon3d34d123 wrote:

[code] }

    if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights >= 1) {
        try {
            int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
            int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

            if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
            } else {
                sendMessage("That Item Doesn't Exist");
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("Use as: ::pickup 04151 1");
        }
    }[/code]

np.

item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

OMFG!! I don’t think it’s the command, i ripped out an old ::pickup command from an old source, still 100 errors!! hmm…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 30, 2009, 05:22:48 am[/size][hr]Yes! I finally got somehwere, 1 error

[code]
client.java:3218: ‘else’ without ‘if’
else if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
^

1 error[/code]

and the command

[code]else if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));
if (newItemID <= 30000 && newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sendMessage(“That Item Doesn’t Exist”);
}
} catch (Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Wrong syntax! use as ::pickup 00995 10”);
}

	}
}[/code]

item.title: Stupid me... Pickup again... 1 error now!
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

No, if you lok on every server it has that, it’s the void so it recognises the command, sorry i shouldn’t of posted that it’s not needed, just look on the ::pickup command :L soz, ill edit it now.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 30, 2009, 05:09:58 am[/size][hr]Chassy, this is my code now, still have 100 errors!!

[code]if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights > 2)) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
sendMessage(“usage Use as ::pickup 800 100”);
}

	[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 30, 2009, 05:12:30 am[/size][hr]just wondering, i deleted like 200 commands, so after the ::pickup it goes to

[code]public void customCommand(String command) {
actionAmount++;
}
if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerRights > 2)) {
String[] args = command.split(" ");
if (args.length == 3) {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} else {
sendMessage(“usage Use as ::pickup 800 100”);
}

public void debug(String text) {
	if (debug)
		sendMessage(text);
}[/code]

item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

		if (command.startsWith("pickup") && (playerRights > 2)) {
			String[] args = command.split(" ");
			if (args.length == 3) {
				int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
				int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
				if ((newItemID <= 20000) && (newItemID >= 0)) {
					addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
				} else {
					sendMessage("No such item.");
				}
			} else {
				sendMessage("usage Use as ::pickup 800 100");
			}
		}
